Standard_Text: Use a variety of information resources to deliver oral presentations that express main ideas supported by significant details.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Appreciate and respond to creative expressions of information:
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Communicate with others outside the school environment through the use of technology to share information (e.g., video conference, blog, wiki, chat room, discussion board).
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Evaluate information of a personal interest for accuracy, credibility, and relevance.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Seek, produce, and share information:
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Understand and describe the purpose of age-appropriate book awards (e.g., Caldecott, Newbery, California Young Reader).
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Read a good representation of grade-level-appropriate text, making progress toward the goal of reading 500,000 words annually (e.g., classic and contemporary literature, magazines, newspapers, online information).
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Read widely and use various media for information, personal interest, and lifelong learning:
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Students integrate information literacy skills into all areas of learning.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Select a focus, an organizational structure, and a point of view for a report or presentation based upon purpose, audience, length, and format requirements.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Understand and use a variety of organizational structures, as appropriate, to convey information (e.g., chronological order, cause and effect, similarity and difference, posing and answering a question).
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use information and technology creatively to answer a question, solve a problem, or enrich understanding:
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Summarize the main ideas and the most significant details of research results.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Draw conclusions and make informed decisions:
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Understand the environment of Internet anonymity and that not everyone on the Internet is truthful and reliable.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use approved or personal passwords appropriately.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Identify author, title, copyright date, and publisher.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Demonstrate ethical, legal, and safe use of information in print, media, and online resources:
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Students use information.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Verify accuracy of prior knowledge.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Consider the need for additional information:
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Recognize the role of media to persuade, interpret events, and transmit culture.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Distinguish between fact and opinion in expository text.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Identify the factors that make a source comprehensive, current, credible, authoritative, and accurate.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Assess the comprehensiveness, currency, credibility, authority, and accuracy of resources:
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Extract and record appropriate and significant information from the text (notetaking).
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Determine the relevance of the information:
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Students evaluate information.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Extract information from illustrations, photographs, charts, graphs, maps, and tables in print, nonprint, and digital formats.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Retrieve information in a timely, safe, and responsible manner:
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use electronic menus and icons (e.g., search, content, help screen, index, key words) to locate information.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Define URL Internet extensions (e.g., .com, .org, .edu, .gov, .us, .net).
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Define online terms (e.g., home page, Web site, responsibility statement, search engine, uniform resource locator [URL]).
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Understand the organization of newspapers and periodicals, both in print and online, and how to use them.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Explain the basic organization of the library classification system (e.g., 10 major Dewey decimal system classifications).
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use Standard reference tools online and in print, including dictionaries, atlases, thesauruses, encyclopedias, and almanacs.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Identify and locate a variety of resources online and in other formats by using effective search strategies:
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Identify words with multiple meanings that may affect a search.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Formulate appropriate questions:
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Recognize and use appropriate "pre-search" strategies (e.g., recall of prior knowledge).
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Identify a more complex problem or question that needs information.
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Recognize the need for information:
Subject: Library (2010-)

Standard_Text: Students access information.
Subject: Library (2010-)
